html.p: Description: Each bar represents the total number of devices that are connected to a particular security component. The Lansweeper bar displays the number of devices that have Lansweeper. The Vulnerability Scanner bar displays the number of devices that have either Qualys or Tenable. The Antivirus bar displays the number of devices that have CrowdStrike, Kaspersky, Defender, or Sophos.

chart.title: Number of Devices That Lack A Specific Security Component

search.query: | table Total, No_Lansweeper, No_Vulnerability_Scanner, No_Antivirus, No_Splunk

condition.set: NOT (sophos_last_event=* OR defender_last_event=* OR crowdstrike_last_event=* OR kaspersky_last_event=*)

html.p: Description: Each bar represents the total number of devices that lack a particular security component. The Lansweeper bar displays the number of devices where Lansweeper is absent. The Vulnerability Scanner displays the number of devices where Qualys or Tenable are absent. The Antivirus bar displays the number of devices that lack the following antivirus software: CrowdStrike, Kaspersky, Defender, and Sophos Endpoint Protection.
You can use IP subnet mask search for IP, like 10.1.1.0/24 or you can also use a wildcard (*) can be used to search IP Address range like: 10.1.1.*
A wildcard (*) is added by default at the front and end of Host, User and Mac Address filters.

search.query: search $tkn_sp_filter$ | table uuid, hostname, ip, mac_address, os, user $tkn_tablefields_lansweeper$ $tkn_tablefields_qualys$ $tkn_tablefields_tenable$, active_vul, high_vul $tkn_tablefields_sophos$ $tkn_tablefields_defender$ $tkn_tablefields_crowdstrike$ $tkn_tablefields_kaspersky$ tmp_* ip_drilldown hostname_drilldown user_drilldown | search $tkn_host$ $tkn_ip$ $tkn_user$ $tkn_mac$
